page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This is a rural area which includes sections of four parishes, Avenbury, Acton Beauchamp, Bishops Frome, and Stanford Bishop.The adult population consists of approximately 9l people living in 43 houses. There are very few young children but several teenagers. The area is situated in pleasant, quiet surroundings, with views of the Malvern Hills to the east, with Bromyard Downs and Clee Hill to the north. There are several large areas of woodland; many hedges are made up of briars, hawthorn and hazel. Apart from Munderfield, which is very small, there are no villages. Further afield, but very accessible, are the cities of Hereford to the south-west and Worcester to the east. There is virtually no industry in the area.
